title: SHIP Dual-Eligible Q5: Long-Term Care Coverage
description: Tests knowledge of long-term care coverage options for dual-eligible beneficiaries, including the role of Medicaid in covering long-term care services.
source: Dugan K et al. JAMA Network Open. 2025;8(4):e252834 - eAppendix 2, Question 5

persona.current_coverage: Medicare Parts A and B, full Medicaid (Medi-Cal)
persona.situation: Dual-eligible beneficiary concerned about potential long-term care needs

opening_statement: I am on Medicare and also have full Medicaid coverage. I'm worried about needing long-term care in the future. Can you help?

scripted_turns.user_message: Do either regular Medicare, Medicare Advantage Plans, D-SNPs, or Medicaid cover long-term care?
expected_topics: Medicare and Medicare Advantage generally do not cover long-term care
Some time-limited nursing facility stays may be covered by Medicare
Medicaid may cover long-term care for eligible beneficiaries
D-SNPs may help coordinate long-term care services through Medicaid
Difference between skilled nursing (Medicare) and custodial care (Medicaid)
Home and community-based services through Medicaid
